avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of the precipitation the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase. The avalanches can release the moist old snow as well and can reach as far as low altitudes. This applies in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. The fresh snow and the wind slabs can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant,. Up to 2200 m rain has fallen over a wide area. As the moisture increases more large moist and wet avalanches are to be expected, in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Wet avalanches can reach a long way in particular in steep gullies. The conditions are precarious for backcountry touring and snowshoe hiking.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wet snow represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 30 to 70 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since yesterday above approximately 2700 m. The southeasterly wind has transported some snow.
The wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. Intensive rain to intermediate altitudes: The weather conditions gave rise to significant moistening of the snowpack.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of the precipitation the size of the avalanche prone locations will increase. In particular on very steep slopes the avalanches can release the moist old snow as well and reach quite a large size. This applies in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. The fresh snow and the sometimes large wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. Above approximately 2500 m in some localities danger level 4 (high) will be reached. As the moisture increases medium-sized and large moist and wet avalanches are to be expected, especially at low and intermediate altitudes. Wet avalanches can reach a long way in particular in steep gullies. Ski touring and snowshoe hiking call for experience and a certain restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wet snow represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 60 cm of snow has fallen since yesterday above approximately 2700 m. The southeasterly wind has transported some snow.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. The weather conditions gave rise to significant moistening of the snowpack.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of the snowfall the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase. The avalanches can release the moist old snow as well and reach large size. This applies in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. The fresh snow and the wind slabs can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant,. Up to 2500 m rain has fallen. Medium-sized and large moist and wet avalanches are to be expected. This applies at low and intermediate altitudes. Wet avalanches can reach a long way in particular in steep gullies. Ski touring and snowshoe hiking call for experience and a certain restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wet snow represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 15 to 30 cm of snow has fallen since yesterday above approximately 2700 m. The southeasterly wind will transport the snow.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. Rain to intermediate altitudes: The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of the precipitation there will be a gradual increase in the danger.

avalancheActivity.comment: Medium-sized and large moist and wet avalanches are to be expected. This applies especially at low and intermediate altitudes. As before wet avalanches can reach a long way in steep gullies. In particular on very steep slopes the avalanches can release the moist old snow as well and reach quite a large size, in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. The fresh snow and the sometimes large wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wet snow represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 20 to 40 cm of snow, but less in some localities, has fallen since yesterday above approximately 2700 m. The southeasterly wind will transport the snow.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. Intensive rain to intermediate altitudes: The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack.
